p: There were, in total, 120 serum samples of dengue infected individuals analysed between 2013 and 2015. Among these 120 samples, a total of 62 (51%) were male, 35 (29%) female, and 23 (20%) paediatric (0–5 years old) dengue cases ( Fig. 1). Both males and females belong to 30–40 years age group with an approximate ratio of 2:1. This ratio is similar with the previous reported value ( Mishra et al., 2015). There were 23 (20%) pediatric (0–5 years old) cases, consisting of 14 males and nine females. Out of 120 serum samples, 100 (83%) were found to be NS1 positive, indicating the possibility of finding dengue viral RNA genome.
